articles.title: Chinese cities relax testing rules as zero-Covid policy eases
articles.description: In capital Beijing, commuters are no longer required to show negative virus test taken within 48 hours to use public transport.
articles.content:
Businesses reopened and testing requirements were relaxed in Beijing and other Chinese cities on Monday as the country tentatively eases out of a strict zero-Covid policy that sparked nationwide protests.

articles.title: Risky online behaviour ‘almost normalised’ among young people, says study
articles.description: EU-funded survey of people aged 16-19 finds one in four have trolled someone – while UK least ‘cyberdeviant’ of nine countries
articles.content: Risky and criminal online behaviour is in danger of becoming normalised among a generation of young people across Europe, according to EU-funded research that found one in four 16- to 19-year-olds have trolled someone online and one in three have eng... [4359 chars]

articles.title: Indonesia’s Mount Semeru erupts, burying homes in volcanic debris
articles.description: Improved weather conditions allowed rescuers in Indonesia to resume evacuation efforts and a search for possible victims after the eruption of Mount Semeru.
articles.content:
SUMBERWULUH, Indonesia — Improved weather conditions Monday allowed rescuers to resume evacuation efforts and a search for possible victims after the highest volcano on Indonesia’s most densely populated island erupted, set off by monsoon rains.

articles.description: The president of Ukraine embodies the resilience of his people and has become a standard bearer for liberal democracy

articles.title: Caspian seal deaths: Thousands of dead seals wash up in Russia's Dagestan
articles.description: Around 2,500 endangered seals have been found dead on Russia's Caspian coast, state-run news agency RIA Novosti reported Sunday, citing authorities in the North Caucasus region.
articles.content:
CNN —
Around 2,500 endangered seals have been found dead on Russia’s Caspian coast, state-run news agency RIA Novosti reported Sunday, citing authorities in the North Caucasus region.

articles.title: Yuan jumps past 7 per dollar as China eases some COVID curbs
articles.description: China's yuan firmed past the closely watched 7-per-dollar level on Monday, hitting its strongest since mid-September, as Beijing eased some of its strict COVID-19 curbs, potentially attracting fresh foreign inflows.
articles.content:
SHANGHAI – China’s yuan firmed past the closely watched 7-per-dollar level on Monday, hitting its strongest since mid-September, as Beijing eased some of its strict COVID-19 curbs, potentially attracting fresh foreign inflows.

articles.title: COVID confusion in China as authorities row back curbs
articles.description: A patchwork easing of the world's toughest COVID-19 curbs sowed confusion across China on Monday, spurring hopes for more clarity as officials shift tone on the dangers posed by the coronavirus in the wake of last month's unprecedented protests.
articles.content:

articles.title: G7 begins to press Russia on Ukraine with oil price cap
articles.description: A Group of Seven (G7) price cap on Russian seaborne oil came into force on Monday as the West tries to limit Moscow's ability to finance its war in Ukraine, though Russia has said it will not abide by the measure even if it has to cut production.

articles.title: Mount Semeru: Thousands evacuated after Indonesia volcano erupts
articles.description: Indonesia's Mount Semeru erupted on Sunday, blanketing roads and homes in volcanic ash and prompting evacuations of nearly 2,000 residents in East Java province, according to authorities in the country.
articles.content:
Jakarta, Indonesia CNN —
Indonesia’s Mount Semeru erupted on Sunday, blanketing roads and homes in volcanic ash and prompting evacuations of nearly 2,000 residents in East Java province, according to authorities in the country.
